metadata.synopsis: Dialog with Laezel regarding the Gith egg.- Conversation about just taking it from the hatchery- Conversation after players give the egg to Lady Esther- If players kept it in Act3:- - Conversation about how the egg is doing. Reactivity based on whether it's in Laezel's inventory. Later in epilogue, if it was in her inventory, it would be hatched and she would be mentioning it.- If players lose the egg or get it destroyed before reaching Act3:- - Laezel is not yet attached to it, so she mentions that it wouldn't have survived anyway- If players lose the egg or get it destroyed after reaching Act3:- - Conversation about Laezel being mad at you for not taking good enough care of it- If players gave it to Lady Esther, after seeing the hatched gith in Act3:- - Conversation about what happened to the kid and how he turned out, depending on Laezel's current views and outcomes of the situation (boy attacked you and you killed him OR convinced him that you're good or he's flawed in his beliefs and he didn't attack you)Follow up in Epilogue:- If Laezel kept the egg, it hatches and she can talk more about it- If players kept the egg or left it in camp, it hatches and we get a Gazette update about it- If players destroyed or misplaced the egg, it's not mentioned in the epilogue
metadata.how_to_trigger: Multiple ways organically. The different branches trigger at different times. Usually by asking a question in the question bank, but obtaining the egg, giving the egg to Lady Esther and dealing with the hatched Gith kid in Act3 will also prompt an exclamation mark for a time.

5.speaker: Lae'zel
5.text: Bah - that was a githyanki egg, not some arcane curiosity for pawning off on shady scholars!
5.context: NodeContext: Almost about to wonder what might have been if you'd kept the egg and let it hatch in your care.

74.speaker: Lae'zel
74.text: Who knows what atrocities will be inflicted upon it?

19.speaker: Player
19.text: It's just an egg, Lae'zel. If it were going to hatch, it already would have.

46.speaker: Lae'zel
46.text: Life still pulses inside it. The egg could nurture a great future kith'rak, a winner of wars, and you chucked it to the first bidder.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Hush up. You're lucky I didn't make an omelette out of it.

18.speaker: Lae'zel
18.text: Life still pulses inside that egg. It could nurture a great future kith'rak, a winner of wars, and you chucked it at the first bidder.

48.speaker: Lae'zel
48.text: You can still take it back by force. You've spilled your share of blood. What's a little more, if it means proving you haven't fully lost your failing senses?

68.speaker: Player
68.text: You're right, Lae'zel. But what's done is done.

8.speaker: Lae'zel
8.text: Better the egg were destroyed than to spawn such... such an anomaly.
8.context: NodeContext: Almost about to wonder what might have been if you'd kept the egg and let it hatch in your care.

36.speaker: Lae'zel
36.text: His death was a blessed escape. He could never understand the weight of Vlaakith's chains... or the relief to come when Orpheus lifts them.
36.context: NodeContext: Almost about to wonder what might have been if you'd kept the egg and let it hatch in your care.

10.speaker: Lae'zel
10.text: Mother Gith would have me look ahead, never behind. But I can only wonder -

9.speaker: Lae'zel
9.text: How might that boy have served his people, if he'd only been given the chance?

38.speaker: Lae'zel
38.text: He will never suffer under Vlaakith's yoke. But he will also never see the crash of the Comet, or live freely in the prince's glow.
38.context: NodeContext: Almost about to wonder what might have been if you'd kept the egg and let it hatch in your care.

58.speaker: Lae'zel
58.text: He deserved to know Vlaakith's protocols, slaughtered ghaik, ascended and known his queen's undead glory.
58.context: NodeContext: Almost about to wonder what might have been if you'd kept the egg and let it hatch in your care.

73.speaker: Lae'zel
73.context: NodeContext: Almost about to wonder what might have been if you'd kept the egg and let it hatch in your care.

69.speaker: Lae'zel
69.text: Vlaakith would never ascend a deviant like this. He will never know her protocols, never ride a dragon to the City of Death.
69.context: NodeContext: Almost about to wonder what might have been if you'd kept the egg and let it hatch in your care.

25.speaker: Lae'zel
25.context: NodeContext: Almost about to wonder what might have been if you'd kept the egg and let it hatch in your care.

62.speaker: Lae'zel
62.text: No, I must look only ahead, never behind. I suggest you do the same.

11.speaker: Lae'zel
11.text: The egg grows ever warmer, the hum of life within it louder. It may yet hatch - though not soon, by my estimation.
11.context: InternalNodeContext: Intentionally not checking if the player has it - this dialog will not play if it's not in their possession.

16.speaker: Lae'zel
16.text: The egg grows ever warmer, the hum of life within it louder. It may yet hatch - though not soon, by my estimation.
16.context: InternalNodeContext: Intentionally not checking if the player has it - this dialog will not play if it's not in their possession.

67.speaker: Lae'zel
67.text: Give it to me. Perhaps it will fare better under my care.
67.context: InternalNodeContext: Intentionally not checking if the player has it - this dialog will not play if it's not in their possession.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I don't suppose you'd consider parenting the child when it hatches.
1.context: InternalNodeContext: Intentionally not checking if the player has it - this dialog will not play if it's not in their possession.

17.speaker: Lae'zel
17.text: Well. Most certainly not. Githyanki are raised by a varsh and trained by a sa'varsh. We are neither.

76.speaker: Lae'zel
76.text: Should the egg hatch, we will find a suitable home for the whelp. I will hand it to the kith'raki when the time comes.

63.speaker: Lae'zel
63.text: Perhaps Crèche K'liir would take them in. Sa'varsh Urlon is a stern taskmaster. The fledgling would be stronger and smarter by dint of his teachings.

3.speaker: Lae'zel
3.text: After we free Orpheus we can visit the matter. If the egg hatches beforehand...

34.speaker: Lae'zel
34.text: ... well. We will shield it from the lich queen's zealots. Whatever may come, I will not let Vlaakith poison the fledgling with lies.

77.speaker: Lae'zel
77.text: Bah. Parentage - a notion so foreign I was sure it was fiction when I first read of it in the slates.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: You're getting attached! Should I start calling you 'Mommy Lae'zel'?
39.context: InternalNodeContext: Intentionally not checking if the player has it - this dialog will not play if it's not in their possession.

79.speaker: Lae'zel
79.text: Only if you want me to roast you over a campfire using my blade as a spit.

71.speaker: Lae'zel
71.text: Githyanki are raised by a varsh and trained by a sa'varsh. We are neither.

0.speaker: Lae'zel
0.text: But it is true that I feel some manner of - responsibility - for this unhatched whelp.

44.speaker: Lae'zel
44.text: After we free Orpheus we can revisit the matter. If the egg hatches beforehand...

33.speaker: Player
33.text: We should keep it in camp, away from danger.
33.context: InternalNodeContext: Intentionally not checking if the player has it - this dialog will not play if it's not in their possession.

70.speaker: Lae'zel
70.text: The very notion puts me ill at ease. Our camp has been visited by all manner of devils and tainted by the Chosen of Bhaal.

64.speaker: Lae'zel
64.text: The very notion puts me ill at ease. Our camp has been visited by a scheming devil and tainted by the Chosen of Bhaal.

7.speaker: Lae'zel
7.text: It has afforded us as much disquiet as it has rest.

20.speaker: Lae'zel
20.text: Leave the egg with me. There's no need for further discussion.

72.speaker: Lae'zel
72.text: A camp once visited by a scheming devil is no safe haven for the unhatched. It has afforded us as much disquiet as it has rest.

57.speaker: Player
57.context: InternalNodeContext: Intentionally not checking if the player has it - this dialog will not play if it's not in their possession.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: The egg is a distraction. It can stay where it is.

13.speaker: Lae'zel
13.text: The egg is not a distraction, it is a stimulation. It harbours not just a fledgling, but a testament of my mission.

43.speaker: Lae'zel
43.text: An effigy of githyanki destiny, incubating before our very eyes.

47.speaker: Lae'zel
47.text: I know it is a mere egg. It may never hatch. If it does, it might beget a failure.

32.speaker: Lae'zel
32.text: But it might also beget a fighter. And I intend to give it the chance.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: No. The egg is better off where it is.

42.speaker: Lae'zel
42.text: Chk. Then I will entrust the egg to you. Begrudgingly, if it weren't obvious.

49.speaker: Lae'zel
49.text: If the egg survives in your care, I invite you to wallow in my wrongness with all the glee you can conjure.

51.speaker: Lae'zel
51.text: In its heat lives stimulation, and in its throbbing, exhilaration. An effigy of githyanki future, incubated inside a fragile shell.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I don't suppose you'd consider parenting the child when it hatches.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: You're getting attached! Should I start calling you 'Mommy Lae'zel'?

30.speaker: Player
30.text: We should keep it in camp, away from danger.

24.speaker: Lae'zel
24.text: An unhatched githyanki egg should be the burden of a varsh, not a warrior, whether ascended or otherwise.

31.speaker: Lae'zel
31.text: And yet - I'm drawn to the warmth of it. A child of Gith and a servant of Vlaakith grows within.
31.context: NodeContext: A momentary maternal instinct comes over Lae'zel

59.speaker: Lae'zel
59.text: Keep it close. Perhaps in our care, it might yet hatch.

75.speaker: Lae'zel
75.text: And don't you dare pass it to that lunatic woman prowling the mountain pass.

52.speaker: Lae'zel
52.text: Perhaps I might be the one to teach it of Vlaakith's Protocols.

53.speaker: Lae'zel
53.text: And yet - I'm drawn to the warmth of it. A child of Gith grows within.

27.speaker: Lae'zel
27.text: The egg is gone? Chk - I was a fool to let you anywhere near it.

37.speaker: Lae'zel
37.text: The egg is gone? Chk - I was a fool to let you anywhere near it.

56.speaker: Lae'zel
56.text: Though perhaps - perhaps it was inevitable.

40.speaker: Lae'zel
40.text: A fragile thing - easily lost, easily broken. But inside it, I glimpsed a speck of my people's future.

15.speaker: Lae'zel
15.text: A future I will fight for, and one I would die for.
